How can I remove the title from my seaborn lineplot legend? I have tried using the solution given in this reply, but it doesn't seem to work. When I run the following code:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns; sns.set()
fmri = sns.load_dataset("fmri")
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
g = sns.lineplot(x="timepoint", y="signal", hue="event", data=fmri, ax=ax)
ax.legend().set_title('')
```
I still see the title in my lineplot. I get the same result when I try to set the title to `None`. However, when I try setting the title to something else, it seems to prepend to the existing title. It almost looks like seaborn is treating the title as a hidden legend entry. How can I resolve this?

It seems like you're encountering a common issue with Seaborn's handling of legend titles. In Seaborn, when you use the `hue` parameter, it automatically creates a legend with a title corresponding to the name of the hue variable, in this case, "event". To remove the title completely, you can use a slightly different approach by accessing the legend after it's created and setting the title to an empty string directly. Here's how you can do it:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns; sns.set()

# Load the dataset
fmri = sns.load_dataset("fmri")

# Create the plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
g = sns.lineplot(x="timepoint", y="signal", hue="event", data=fmri, ax=ax)

# Get the legend and set the title to an empty string
legend = ax.get_legend()
legend.set_title('')  # Set the legend title to an empty string
```

In this code, `ax.get_legend()` retrieves the legend object, and `legend.set_title('')` effectively removes the title by setting it to an empty string. This should resolve the issue and remove the title from your legend.
